passage_text: Steel Building Site Services Costs and Price Comparisons. Bottom line is you can spend as little as $25 - $30 per Sq. ft. up to $100 - $125 per sq. ft. It all depends on your design. CALL or CONTACT ME for your no obligation conseltation to get a valid budget with reasonable expectations.

An average commercial steel building costs between $16 and $20 per square foot, including building package (I-Beams, purlins, girts etc.) , delivery, foundation and the cost of construction. Local building regulations can influence the cost of a steel commercial building. For example, buildings in colder climates may need to handle a large volume of snow, while buildings in areas that are prone to hurricanes need to be resistant to high winds.

1 Anyone interested in building a do-it-yourself residential steel building can expect to pay around $10 to $20 per square foot for materials. 2  If you need help with labor, factor in another $5 to $10 per square foot. 3  Residential steel homes with the following square footage might cost approximately: 1 Residential steel homes with the following square footage might cost approximately: 2  A 1,500 square foot residence: $30,000 to $60,000. 3  A 2,400 square foot residence: $50,000 to $100,000. 4  A 5,000 square foot residence: $100,000 to $200,000.

Materials for an average sized, residential steel building can range $7 per square foot for large buildings such as a 80x100 building and go up to $10 PSF for a small 30x40 building. These prices are for the building shell. Quonsets cost less for materials and will start from $5 PSF before accessories, delivery and labor. Also consider the location of the building and whether a foundation and a floor will need to be laid to complete the installation. This can add from $4 to $8 per square foot to the cost for either style of metal building. Therefore, we can summarize the total cost of a steel building project as follows:

1 Adding insulation to a steel residential building costs approximately $1 to $3 per square foot. 2  For accessories such as windows and doors, factor in an additional 15-25% (includes delivery fees and installation). 1 Residential steel homes with the following square footage might cost approximately: 2  A 1,500 square foot residence: $30,000 to $60,000. 3  A 2,400 square foot residence: $50,000 to $100,000. 4  A 5,000 square foot residence: $100,000 to $200,000.

But for sake of giving the best average price for a steel building let include all labor costs. The average price per square foot for a basic steel building is anywhere between $6 and $20. Let's take a look at what variables influence the construction costs of a steel building. Labor. The labor cost of the construction of a basic steel structure typically ranges from $3-$10 per square foot. This price range takes into consideration variables such as the size and location of your building and the competitiveness of your areas labor force

Please note, because there are so many variables involved (interior & exterior finish being the main contributors) with commercial steel buildings, price figures for the average code per square foot can vary dramatically. Local building regulations can influence the cost of a steel commercial building. For example, buildings in colder climates may need to handle a large volume of snow, while buildings in areas that are prone to hurricanes need to be resistant to high winds.

Since many retail & commercial buildings require additional finishing like insulation or facade façade, customization the cost may rise to$ 30 or$ 40 per square (FOOT). For example, buildings in colder climates may need to handle a large volume of snow, while buildings in areas that are prone to hurricanes need to be resistant to high winds.

The following figures should only be used as a rough overview of metal building prices. 1  The cost (materials, delivery, concrete foundation, and assembly) to build a residential steel building is approximately $20 to $40 per square foot or more. 1 Residential steel homes with the following square footage might cost approximately: 2  A 1,500 square foot residence: $30,000 to $60,000. 3  A 2,400 square foot residence: $50,000 to $100,000. 4  A 5,000 square foot residence: $100,000 to $200,000.
